Posts.Content: Jun 1, 2009 06:47AM ebby wrote: My sis in law who is staying with us is starting her first round of chemo June 3rd as well, I'm pretty sure she's been avoiding logging onto the forums to avoid scaring herself or hearing something that might give her anxiety, but I've been doing it just to inform myself!  So I'll be here in this thread as much as possible updating stuff about her chemo journey from a caretaker point of view, its funny now that she's been diagnosed everywhere I go I seem to see kids with hats and no hair, at least one woman a day with her scarf on her head, but walking tall and strong, they honestly look brave when doing nothing at all, they exude something special because of the experiences they are having... so I'm here listening and if theres anyone in the 24-28 year old range with BC that wants to set up maybe a msn chat with my sis in law, please feel free to forward me your email so I can make her add you when you guys are restless and need someone going through what your going through at the exact same time!  Much love ladies.  Ebby

Posts.Title: Just diagnosed, should she take a trip? ebby ebby

Posts.Content: ebby wrote: I have my sister in law staying with us who just returned from working overseas, she came home because she found a lump which has now proven to be invasive breast cancer which has spread to the lymph nodes (just found this out today but we haven't sat down to talk about the extent).  Earlier this week she booked a flight back to Korea to see her boyfriend one last time before she starts her treatment, she's worrying that by going from April 18th to May 5th may affect her ability to beat it if she doesn't get the lump removed right away and is now second guessing her trip to see her boyfriend.  I would like her to go on the trip so she can enjoy herself one last time and see her guy, but I myself am also starting to second guess this trip and whether she should push treatment up faster and cancel the trip which she would leave for tomorrow am... any advice?  The doctor said "its only 2 weeks" saying she might as well go... but understandablely from the posts I've seen on here I see that there can be tons of worry.... put yourself in her shoes from one BC patient to another for a sec, please advise.  Thanks!
